sections.heading: Using a While Loop
sections.description: You can loop through the tuple items by using a while loop. Use the len() function to determine the length of the tuple, then start at 0 and loop your way through the tuple items by referring to their indexes. Remember to increase the index by 1 after each iteration. Learn more about while loops in our Python While Loops Chapter.

code_blocks.notes: Print all items, using a while loop to go through all the index numbers:
code_blocks.code:
thistuple = ("apple", "banana", "cherry")

i = 0

while i < len(thistuple):
